org.ejvm.execution

Class EjvmMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejvm.execution.EjvmMachine

  • public final class EjvmMachine
extends Object

    Represents a machine capable of executing eJVM bytecode and acts as the machine's operating system.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Nicolai Kaupe
    See Also:
    EjvmProcessor, EjvmProcess

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EjvmMachine(int memorySize)
      Creates a new EjvmMachine with a single core and a working memory of memorySize byte.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EjvmMachine

        public EjvmMachine(int memorySize)

        Creates a new EjvmMachine with a single core and a working memory of memorySize byte. However, memorySize is expected to be at least 64 byte.

        Parameters:
        memorySize - The size of the working memory available to the machine. 64 byte minimum.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If memorySize is less than 64 byte.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()

        Resets the virtual machine. All processes are detached from their processors and the working memory is replaced, making sure old processes can not interfere with the machine after its reset.

      • loadProgram

        public EjvmProcessor loadProgram(Path executable)

        Loads the program from executable into the machine's working memory and creates a new EjvmProcess for the execution of the program. The new process is then assigned to the machine's processor. Once this method returns, execution of the loaded program is possible using the appropriate methods of the EjvmProcessor.

        Any data contained previously in the working memory may be overwritten, if needed. Portions unaffected by the loading of the program do not get wiped.

        Please note that the first version of the virtual machine of the eJVM Development Kit does not support parallel (or pseudo-parallel) execution of programs: it is a strict single-program machine.

        Parameters:
        executable - The file to read the program from.
        Returns:
        The EjvmProcessor to whom the newly-created process was assigned.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If executable points to a non-existent file.
        NotExecutableException - If executable cannot be executed, e.g. because the required eJVM version is not supported.
        See Also:
        loadIntoWorkingMemory(byte[], int, int)

      • loadProgram

        public EjvmProcessor loadProgram(EjvmProgram program)

        Loads the program program into the machine's working memory and creates a new EjvmProcess for the execution of the program. The new process is then assigned to the machine's processor. Once this method returns, execution of the loaded program is possible using the appropriate methods of the EjvmProcessor. The input and output channels for the process are set to System.in and System.out and may be changed before execution using the appropriate methods.

        Any data contained previously in the working memory may be overwritten, if needed. Portions unaffected by the loading of the program do not get wiped.

        Please note that the first version of the virtual machine of the eJVM Development Kit does not support parallel (or pseudo-parallel) execution of programs: it is a strict single-process machine.

        Parameters:
        program - The EjvmProgram to be loaded into the machine.
        Returns:
        The EjvmProcessor to whom the newly-created process was assigned.
        Throws:
        NotExecutableException - If executable cannot be executed, e.g. because the required eJVM version is not supported.
        See Also:
        loadIntoWorkingMemory(byte[], int, int)

      • loadIntoWorkingMemory

        public void loadIntoWorkingMemory(byte[] content,
                         int offset,
                         int numberOfBytes)

        Inserts numberOfBytes bytes from content into the machine's working memory, starting insertion into working memory at index offset.

        Parameters:
        content - The content to be loaded into the machine's memory.
        offset - The position from which to start from.
        numberOfBytes - The number of bytes to copy from content into the working memory.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the offset is smaller 0 or bigger than the working memory's capacity or if the length of content combined with offset is bigger than the working memory's capacity.
        IllegalArgumentException - If numberOfBytes is negative.
        See Also:
        loadProgram(Path), getMemoryView(int, int, boolean)

      • getMemoryView

        public ByteBuffer getMemoryView(int offset,
                       int length,
                       boolean readOnly)

        Returns a ByteBuffer providing the caller with a view into the machine's working memory. The view starts at offset and contains length bytes. Depending on readOnly, the returned ByteBuffer may be read-only.

        Parameters:
        offset - The starting byte offset for the returned view.
        length - The length of the view.
        readOnly - If true, the buffer will be read-only.
        Returns:
        A ByteBuffer acting as a view into the working memory.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If offset is negative or the combination of offset and length exceeds the capacity of the working memory.

      • readMemoryAt

        public void readMemoryAt(int offset,
                byte[] dst)

        Reads dst.length bytes from the machine's working memory into dst, starting at offset.

        Parameters:
        offset - The offset in the working memory from which to start reading.
        dst - The byte[] to place the read bytes in.

      • getNumberOfCores

        public int getNumberOfCores()

        Returns the number of cores working in this machine.

        Returns:
        The number of EjvmProcessor instances available to the machine.

      • getProcessor

        public EjvmProcessor getProcessor(int core)

        Returns the EjvmProcessor number core.

        Parameters:
        core - The index of the core in the core table.
        Returns:
        The EjvmProcessor from the core table at core.
